meanings.definition: Tucker (noun): A piece of cloth or other material used to cover the front of a bodice or dress.
meanings.sent1: She sewed delicate tuckers onto the bodice of the dress.
meanings.sent2: The tuckers on her dress added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The tuckers on the dress looked like tiny waves.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was a canvas of tuckers, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The tuckers on the bodice shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Tucker (verb): To make someone tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: The long hike tuckers me out every time.
meanings.sent2: Running around all day can really tuckers you out.
meanings.sent3: I always tucker out after a busy day at work.
meanings.sent4: The intense workout tuckers out my muscles.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle game tuckers out my brain quickly.

meanings.definition: Tucker (noun): A person or thing that tucks or gathers.
meanings.sent1: She was a skilled tuckers, creating beautiful pleats.
meanings.sent2: The tuckers carefully gathered the fabric for the design.
meanings.sent3: The little tuckers in the sewing group were always precise.
meanings.sent4: The tuckers' hands moved swiftly, creating intricate folds.
meanings.sent5: The tuckers' work transformed the plain fabric into a masterpiece.
